item.title: winter 2020-2021
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: quiet and rainy windows are closed, but listen world solitude devotion &ndash; sun that invites you upon inspection seated on winter grass &ndash; computer juxtaposed for final studies this is a coup trump = white supremacy is domestic terrorism carbonation, sip the popping bubbles winter rainfall snow not sticking &ndash; a son honors his father claiming his mantle screen replays gaming loops before me day lost to clouds watching romances traces of myself in every lip’s furl surprise, my kidneys! who knows what occurs beneath skin tree in the wind just so happy to be here bright clouds, cold blue : dark window opened growth of epochs cold inspection for the cold veggie harvest &ndash; in warm clothes the repeat burglar saunters through those aisles again

item.title: fall-winter 2019
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall subjects follow as queen bows her head &ndash; almost winter&rsquo;s turn flock of ducks survey centennial waters sun bids the cold

item.title: fall-winter 2018
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall to her autumn means outside ball is everything grey room fits dying leaves, not how he feels winter before happened two fraternal hounds &ndash; dry yard grass no order in time&rsquo;s quanta next does not exist
